text: Hi guys

Kerryann here, I'm going to show you this

it's a Turkish style couscous salad and
it's inspired by my best friend
who taught me how to make it
It's delicious packed full of flavor
it's really good for you it's great on its own, it's great as a side dish

it's great as a light snack or supper.
It's just great all-round.
Let me teach you, how to make it too!
In this bowl I have got 250 grams
of just plain old regular couscous.
We're gonna bring this to life with a nice pinch of salt
a nice pinch of pepper
I've got teaspoon of ground cumin
and a teaspoon of smoked paprika
and I'm going to sprinkle that over the couscous
and just stir it all in
I'm gonna grab some boiling water and
just gonna cover it. Because there is no exact measurement depends on which

vessel you're doing it in. This is quite a
big bowl.

I'm gonna cover that with some cling
film and put it to one side
every single little grain of couscous is going to soak up all that water
and then it's going to become nice and fluffy
and then it'll soak it up a lot quicker

Lovely. So first I've got a nice medium red
onion
and I'm gonna finely chop took this. I wanna take off the end. I wanna leave the root on.
because that's gonna hold the onion together while I chop it
Cut it in half
peel it quickly, well might not be quickly
to finely chop the onion, come in closer
I'm gonna put the knife in
quite close together this time
not all the way to the root
we've got a nice fan effect now
so I'm gonna chop that up and this little root is going to hold it all together for me

that doesn't spread all over the board.
You don't have to be a top chef
to be able to chop stuff small
You just have to be able to concentrate and then we'll move on to the cucumber
I've got a medium cucumber

We're just gonna chop this again
really finely
Something like that
So we're left with like that kind of size

and you wanna do that with the whole
cucumber
Okay now I need two medium
ripe tomatoes.Just gonna slice them

About half a centimetre thick. If you don't
what half a centimeter is

we're gonna chuck these in with the cucumber and onion

and then I want the same of flat leaf
parsley

I'm just using the rocking method here

just put the tip of the knife on the

now want you to come and have a look at

Now you can do this with a spoon guys

Rub it in so that every single grain is

I've got the bowl with the chili and the tomato and the cucumber and the onion

then we're gonna add in our herbs... that's the parsley

the coriander and the mint... it just smells

Now I've got a nice big fat lemon and I'm gonna roll it on the bench
just applying a little bit of pressure.
All the little capsules inside the lemon

that will burst them so you'll get twice as
much juice for the same price
Let's cut that...
Now I'm not going to put all off this lemon juice in
just yet, in case we use too much. My nan always told me, you can always add, but you can never take away
Same with salt
So i'm going to put half of the juice of the lemon, grab some olive oil
A nice healthy generous drizzle, remember it is a dressing
so not just a drizzle
and we'll need to add a little bit of salt.
again you can always add, but you can never take away
add a bit more pepper
give it a taste
absolutely beautiful
